title.rendered: Luis Figo remarks on Ronaldo United Manchester part away

content.rendered:
Manchester United recently proclaimed that they need reciprocally compound ways with Cristiano Ronaldo. Portuguese star striker Cristiano Ronaldo has been subjected to intense criticism over his recent interview with British journalist Piers Morgan. within the interview, Ronaldo criticized the manager Erik ten Hag, and the club homeowners, language that he felt “betrayed” by the club.
Former European nation captain Luis Figo feels that the “mutual agreement” between Ronaldo and United is helpful for each side, player,and the club.
“No, not at all. Finally, regarding the things that came, I feel it absolutely was the choice of each. A mutual agreement – I feel is helpful for each. As a result, he wasn’t enjoying and the club feels that the player does not wish to remain. He is, in fact, a special player, a very important player however at the equivalent time he wasn’t enjoying, not being an Associate in Nursing possibility for the coach. When I feel the interview – he was restless regarding the club and also the club determined with a mutual agreement to separate the destiny of each. Well, it’s like that – mutual agreement. All are happy.,” Figo spoke out in his discussion with Sports18.
Figo additionally spoke on Ronaldo’s future with the European nation captain currently a free agent, following the termination of his contract. He feels that Ronaldo’s future can currently rely on multiple factors.
“Well, I do not understand. I feel it is often a private call, betting on the goals he has, and the offers that are coming back currently. However, this is often a private and sportive call of his, betting on the clubs that wish him,” he added.
Ronaldo will be seen in action on Thursday, as Portugal takes up against Ghana in Group H.
In this World cup of FIFA, many upsetting results are expected in further rounds.

Read Also: Ronaldo and Manchester United part away
